Thanks for the update. I have informed Envest that disabling REST API breaks our page.

I am waiting for their response on that.

There was another request they have made which I missed. It was:


  1. Configure your web server to block requests to /?author=<number>



Can this be actioned?

Thanks again.

Thanks for sharing the page.

  1. Limiting access to wp-admin and wp-login.php. (https://sgua.com.au/backend/, https://www.pi-plus.com.au/backend/)
  2. Disabling WordPress REST API (Cannot be disabled)
  3. Disabling WordPress XML-RPC (Done)

Let me know if you need more changes to the site.

Hi team,

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi team,

Envest has performed some pen test on our websites (sgua.com.au and pi-plus.com.au) and have come across some vulnerabilities they would like addressed for both the sites.
Below are some suggestions they have made for the two websites.

  1. Limiting access to wp-admin and wp-login.php .
  2. Disabling WordPress REST API
  3. Disabling WordPress XML-RPC

Is there a way we can achieve these requirements? In limiting access to wp-admin (point 1) we were looking at possibly limiting it to a whitelist of address. Please let me know if this is possible.
The other two, I am interested to know what are affected if we disable them.

I appreciate any assistance you can provide me.

Thanks.


Sreetheran Nair | IT Manager

Proplab - Powering SGUA & Property Insurance Plus
E:Sreetheran.Nair@theproplab.com.au

www.sgua.com.au

www.pi-plus.com.au
